result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D Sullivan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge and all applicable costs, surcharges and fees by 07-23-2020 or civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept

Credit for 12 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence but CONCURRENT to Case 13CM5403

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. Upon successful completion of the sentence, Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law within 18 months, upon submission of motion. Expungement is not contingent upon payment of costs or fees

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael D Sullivan

records.addlTxt: JOC Corrected to change the case number that this case is concurrent with

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. Upon successful completion of the sentence, Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law within 18 months, upon submission of motion. Expungement is not contingent upon payment of costs or fees

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve TWELVE (12) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence BUT CONCURRENT TO 13CM5403 with credit for TWELVE (12) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and fees BY 07-23-2020 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.
* Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay any applicable surcharge.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law WITHIN EIGHTEEN (18) MONTHS, upon submission of motion.  EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTINGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR FEES.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Michael D Sullivan in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State RENEWED their motion to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense and Defendant CONCEDED that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Matter proceeded to Sentencing before Br. 33.
Pretrial Services Violation Report-07-23-2018.  Filed, sdg.
Filed, sdg.

Defendant Michael D Sullivan in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense requested the motion be taken under advisement at this time.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defense to have the matter staffed by the E/I team.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Status.  COURT TOOK THE MOTION TO REVOKE UNDER ADVISEMENT AT THIS TTIME.  Status conference scheduled for July 23, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Filed, sdg.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael D Sullivan in court with attorney David Thomas Conley.  Defendant Michael D Sullivan in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 33.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 26, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Filed, sdg.
Completion of Representation.  Filed, sdg.
03/29/18 Deferred Prosecution Agreement Discharge Letter.  Filed, sdg.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Student Intern Jack McNally under Attorney Amanda M. Parent in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
01/25/18 Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Michael D Sullivan in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for January 29, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael D Sullivan in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defendant has NOT started the TWENTY-FIVE (25) HOURS of Community Service as of this hearing.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defendant will need to complete a 'Letter of Reflection'.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for December 4, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael D Sullivan in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Randy Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
BRANCH 10 for BRANCH 31.  Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for August 8, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Michael D Sullivan in court with attorney Amanda Parent.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case in court for pretrial conference. defense requests a plea date. Case remains calendared in Branch 31.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 1, 2017 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defense Notice of Motion and Motion to Remove Defendant's Case from Domestic Violence Court, received and filed.

Defendant Michael D Sullivan in court with attorney Amanda Parent.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defense counsel filed Notice of Motion and Motion to Reassign Case.  State does not object. This case is now assigned to Judge Hannah Dugan in branch 31. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in branch 31.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 17, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael D Sullivan in court with attorney Amanda Parent.  Defendant Michael D Sullivan in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davis, Branch 21.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 3, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
